April 2025 County of Marin EMS ALS PR 2
ADULT INTRAOSSEOUS
PROCEDURE
Indications
Patient in extremis, cardiac arrest, profound hypovolemia, or sepsis and in need of immediate
delivery of medications/fluids and immediate IV access is not possible
Equipment
Procedure Preparation
• Select insertion site based on • Intraosseous infusion needle and/or
mechanical insertion device
manufacturer’s instructions
• Position and stabilize insertion site • Chlorhexidine with alcohol swab or
• Following aseptic technique, prepare ampule
insertion site and allow to dry via air or • If patient has allergy to Chlorhexidine,
gauze use alcohol swab only
• Sterile gauze pads
• 10ml NS syringe
• IV NS solution and tubing with 3-way
Procedure stopcock
• Supplies to secure infusion
• Insert IO needle according
• Pressure bag
to manufacturer’s directions
• Lidocaine 2% (preservative free)
• Confirm placement
• Attach primed extension set
and flush with 10ml NS
If patient awake and/or responsive to pain
• Lidocaine 2% (preservative free) 20-40mg
over 30-60 seconds
• Wait 30-60 seconds before fluid infusion
• MR in 15 min if needed
Critical Information
If resistance is met
• Absolute contraindications:
Remove needle, apply pressure to • Recent fracture of involved bone (less
site and attempt at secondary site than 6 weeks)
• Vascular disruption proximal to insertion
site
• Inability to locate landmarks
• Relative contraindications:
• Stabilize as recommended by manufacturer
• Infection or burn overlying the site
• Attach pre-flooded IV tubing with pressure
• Congenital deformities of the bone
bag for infusion
• Metabolic bone disease
• Monitor insertion site and patient condition
